content:
eads business development or supports owner-led initiatives.
Scope Options
Option A: Supporting Documentation Role ($1,500)
When owners leverage their existing relationships (e.g., Ken's Hattiesburg connections)
Create supporting documentation and presentation materials
Prepare comprehensive project briefing packages
Develop follow-up correspondence templates
Refine materials based on stakeholder feedback
Provide approximately 20 hours of support work
Option B: Active Business Development Role ($30,000)
When North Star leads outreach and relationship building
Dedicated professional business developer with strong connections
North Star Group CEO involvement in key meetings
Comprehensive relationship mapping and contact development
Full meeting attendance and follow-up correspondence
Approximately 3 months of $10,000/month professional business development work
Key Activities
Market Engagement (Both Options)
Institutional Outreach: Target hospital systems, universities, and corporate partners
Renter Recruitment: Engage target demographic groups
Commitment Collection: Gather non-binding commitments segmented by unit type
Feedback Integration: Continuous refinement based on market response
Financing Strategy Focus Areas
ESG Alignment: Engage environmentally and socially conscious funding channels
Community Reinvestment Act (CRA) Opportunities: Target financial institutions with CRA obligations for affordable housing investments
Impact Metrics: Showcase community development and sustainability benefits
Institutional Partnerships: Leverage relationships with impact-focused investors
CRA Compliance Benefits: Position project to help banks meet LMI community credit needs
Term Sheet Negotiation: Structure DD/CD funding based on demonstrated interest
Deliverables
Supporting Documentation (Option A)
Professional presentation materials and project briefings
Institutional partner engagement templates
Renter interest registration system framework
